availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John F. Wisnewski (Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio glycerin maker and soldier)

body.p: Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio glycerin maker and soldier. Native of Prussia. Married to Lisette Wisnewski. Father of Auguste Wisnewski, Johanna Wisnewski, Edmund Wisnewski, Otto Wisnewski, and Francisca Wisnewski. Glycerin maker in Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio in 1860. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Captain from May 31, 1861 to August 18, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 19, p. 495B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 169.
